column4: Part 1: New List of Records of Sutras and Treatises 新集經論錄第一
column8: Reign of Emperor Xiaoming of Han
column18: The catalog compiled by Master Dao’an omits this scripture. Emperor Xiaoming of Han had a dream of a golden man. The emissary Zhang Qian, accompanied by the Yu Lin [Palace Guards] commanded by General Qin Jing, to the Western Regions. When they arrived at Tokara met the monk Kasyapa-Matanga. He returned with them to Luoyang where he translated this scripture. It was stored in Room 40 of the Orchid Terrace. Today the scripture is in general circulation.
column29: Zhou Dynasty Corrected Catalog of Scriptures
column40: There are three prefaces to this sūtra included in fascicle 6 of the Chu San Zang Ji Ji. Funayama (2013, 22) states that this actually appeared in the early fifth century or later.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Lokakṣema produced the Sūtra on the Prajñāpāramitā Practice of the Way in ten fascicles and Gu Pin Yi Ri Shuo Bore in one fascicle. Zhu Foshuo produced the Dao Xing Jing in one fascicle, which is an abridged version of the Prajñāpāramitā Sūtra. Zhu Shixing produced the Fang Guang Jing in twenty fascicles, also known as the Jiu Xiao Pin. Dharmarakṣa later retranslated the Xiaopin Jing in seven fascicles. Wei Shidu compiled an abridged version of the Large Sūtra on the Prajñāpāramitā Practice of the Way in two fascicles.   Dharmapriya produced the Mahāprajñāpāramitā Sūtra in five fascicles, which is also known as the Chang'an Chapters. Kumārajīva produced the new Large Prajñāpāramitā Sūtra (Da Pin) in twenty-four fascicles and the Xiao Pin in seven fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Lokakṣema produced a foreign version of the Parinirvāṇa Sūtra in one fascicle. Zhi Qian produced the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra in two fascicles. Dharmarakṣa produced the Vaipulya Nirvāṇa Sūtra in two fascicles. Dharmakṣema produced the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra in thirty-six fascicles. Shi Faxian produced Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra in six fascicles and the Vaipulya Nirvāṇa Sūtra in two fascicles. Shi Zhimeng produced the Nirvāṇa Sūtra in twenty fascicles. Guṇabhadra produced the Nirvāṇa Sūtra in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: The Old Catalog has the Saddharmapuṇḍarīka Sūtra, why this title is different from the Lotus Sūtra is not clear and who produced it is missing. Dharmarakṣa produced the Lotus Sūtra in ten fascicles. Kumārajīva produced a new version of the Lotus Sūtra in seven fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Lokaṣema produced the Śūraṅgama in two fascicles. Zhi Qian also produced the Śūraṅgama in two fascicles. Baiyan also produced the Śūraṅgama in two fascicles. Dharmarakṣa the Yong Fu Ding [Śūraṃgama Samādhi] in two fascicles, which is also a version of the Śūraṅgama. Zhu Jilan also produced the Śūraṅgama in two fascicles. Kumārajīva produced a new version of the Śūraṅgama in two fascicles. The Old Catalog has  as Shu version of the Śūraṅgama in two fascicles but it is not clear who produced that.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Zhi Qian produced the Vimalakīrti in two fascicles. Dharmarakṣa produced the Vimalakīrti Sūtra in two fascicles and also produced the Shan Weimojie Jing in one fascicle. Zhu Shulan produced the Vimalakīrti in two fascicles. Kumārajīva produced a new version of the Vimalakīrti in three fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Zhi Qian produced the Amitābha Sūtra in two fascicles. Dharmarakṣa produced the Infinite Life Sūtra in two fascicles, also known as Wuliang Qingjing Pingdeng Jue. Kumārajīva produced the Infinite Life Sūtra in one fascicle. Shi Baoyun produced the Infinite Life Sūtra in two fascicles. Guṇabhadra produced the Infinite Life Sūtra in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column5: Sūtra on the Grounds of the Way
column18: An Shigao produced the Greater Sūtra on the Grounds of the Way in two fascicles. Dharmarakṣa produced the Yogacārabhūmi in two fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced the Lalitavistara in eight fascicles. Shi Zhiyan produced the Lalitavistara in six fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced the Bhadrakalpika in ten fascicles. Kumārajīva produced the Bhadrakalpika in seven fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced the Sāgaranāgarāja in four fascicles. Dharmakṣema produced the Sāgaranāgarāja in four fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharma-nandi produced the Madhyama Āgama in fifty-nine fascicles. Saṅghadeva produced the Madhyama Āgama in sixty fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column5: Sūtra on the Creation and Destruction of the World
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced the Creation and Destruction of the World in five fascicles. Shi Faju  produced the Creation and Destruction of the World in six fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Zhi Qian produced the Sublime Grasp in one fascicle. Buddhabhadra  produced the Sublime Grasp in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Shi Faju produced the Vaipulya Tathāgatagarbha in one fascicle. Buddhabhadra produced the Vaipulya Tathāgatagarbha in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Zhi Qian produced Former Karma in one fascicle. Buddhabhadra produced Former Karma in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Kumārajīva produced the Daśabhūmika in four fascicles. Buddhabhadra produced the Ten Abodes of the Bodhisattva in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column5: Sūtra on Surpassing the Brightness of the Sun
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced Surpassing the Brightness of the Sun in two fascicles. Nie Chengyuan  produced Surpassing the Brightness of the Sun in two fascicles, revising the version by Dharmarakṣa.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Lokaṣema produced the Pratyutpanna-Samādhi in two fascicles. Dharmarakṣa produced the Pratyutpanna-Samādhi in two fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column5: The Sūtra on the Enlightenment of Maitreya
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced the Enlightenment of Maitreya in one fascicle. Kumārajīva produced the Enlightenment of Maitreya in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column5: Sūtra on the Prophecy of Avalokiteśvara
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced the Sūtra on the Prophecy of Avalokiteśvara Bodhisattva in one fascicle. Dharmodgata produced Sūtra on the Prophecy of Avalokiteśvara in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Zhi Qian produced the Candraprabha Kumāra Sūtra in one fascicle. Dharmarakṣa produced the Candraprabha Kumāra Sūtra in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced the Universal Gate Sūtra in one fascicle. Gītamitra  produced the Universal Gate Sūtra in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced the Aṅgulimālīya Sūtra in one fascicle. Guṇabhadra produced the Aṅgulimālīya Sūtra in four fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Lokakṣema produced the King Ajātaśatru Sūtra in two fascicles. Dharmarakṣa produced the King Ajātaśatru Sūtra in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: An Shigao produced the Twelve Nidanas in one fascicle. Dharmarakṣa produced the Sūtra on the Twelve Nidanas in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Zhi Qian produced the Akṣayamati in two fascicles. Dharmarakṣa produced the Akṣayamati in four fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Kumārajīva produced the Meditation Sūtra in four fascicles and the Essential Explanation of The Method of Dhyāna in two fascicles. Buddhabhadra produced the Meditation Sūtra in two fascicles. Dharmamitra produced the Essentials of Meditation in two fascicles and the Scripture on the The Five Gates of Chan - Essential Methods in one fascicle. The Lord of Anyang Juqu produced the Sūtra on Essential Chan Methods for Curing Sickness in two fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharmakṣema produced the Vaipulya Ākāśagarbha Sūtra in five fascicles. Dharmamitra produced the Contemplation of Ākāśagarbha in one fascicle. Shengjian produced Ākāśagarbha in five fascicles. Buddhayaśas  produced Ākāśagarbha in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: An Shigao produced Similes for the Five Aggregates in one fascicle. Dharmarakṣa produced Sūtra on Three Hundred Similes in twenty-five fascicles but the subjects of the similes are not known for this title. Shi Faju produced the Dharmapada in six fascicles. Gunavaddhi produced One Hundred Parables in ten fascicles. Kang Fasui produced the Sūtra of Parables in ten fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced Akṣayamati in four fascicles. Zhu Fajuan produced  Akṣayamati in ten fascicles. Dharmakṣema later compiled the Akṣayamati in four fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharmakṣema produced the Bodhisattvabhūmi in eight fascicles. Tripiṭaka Master Guṇavarman produced the Bodhisattva Precepts in ten fascicles.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharma [Zhu Fanian] produced the Ten Part Prātimokṣa in one fascicle. Kumārajīva produced the Ten Part Prātimokṣa in one fascicle. Buddhayaśas produced the Dharmaguptaka Prātimokṣa in one fascicle. Shi Faxian produced the Seng Zhi Biqiu Jie Ben in one fascicle. Buddhajīva produced the Mahiśāsaka Five Part Vinaya Precept Manual for Monks in one fascicle.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: Dharmarakṣa produced the Prātimokṣa for Bhikṣuṇī in one fascicle, now lost. Shi Sengchun produced the Bhikṣuṇī Ordination Vows in one fascicle. Shi Faying produced the Ten Part Prātimokṣa for Bhikṣuṇī in one fascicle. Mili transmitted the Bhikṣuṇī Ordination Vows in one fascicle, which was in the list of doubtful scriptures, now lost.

column4: Part 2: New List of Different Translations of Sūtras 新集異出經錄第二
column18: An Shigao produced the Scripture on the Five Dharmas of the Abhidharma and the Scripture on the Seven Dharmas in two fascicles, now lost. The Seven Dharmas and the Ninety-Eight Dharmas of the Abhidharma are now lost. Saṅghadeva produced the Abhidharma Vibhāṣa in forteen fascicles and the Abhidharmahṛdaya in sixteen fascicles. Saṅghavarman produced the Abhidharmamahāvibhāṣa in fourteen fascicles and the Abhidharmahṛdaya in four fascicles. The Indian Vibhāṣa produced the Śāriputrā Abhidharma in twenty-two fascicles. Buddhavarman produced the Abhidharmamahāvibhāṣa in sixty fascicles. Faxian produced the Saṃyuktābhidharmahṛdaya in thirteen fascicles. Īśvara produced the Saṃyuktābhidharmahṛdaya in thirteen fascicles. Saṃghavarman produced the Saṃyuktābhidharmahṛdaya in fourteen fascicles. It is not known who produced Katyayana’s Abhidharmahṛdaya in twenty fascicles and it has been entered in to the list of anonymously translated texts.

column5: Shuo Ren Zi Shuo Ren Gu Bu Zhi Fu Jing
column18: Dao An says that this is from the first forty-five sūtras in the Saṃyukta Āgama. I have check the Saṃyukta Āgama and found that it only contains twenty-five sūtras. Although the note says forty-five, perhaps it is a transcription error. In fact, the Jin Chronicles also makes an error in writing ‘three pigs’ and the History of Lu in writing ‘five gates.’ Even the ancient sages complained of such errors, let alone paid scribes.

column37: habs mkhas pa chen po saṅs-rgyas drin-lan bsab paḥi mdo
column40: Lancaster (KDC, s.v. K 402) that the Tibetan was translated from Chinese. Fang and Lu (2023, 11) note that it is believed that the sutra was not translated earlier than the Eastern Jin period. Funayama (2013, 138-139) writes that this text was probably composed in China. Fang (2001, 53) analyzes language use, including the use of the function word 非 fēi, to determine that the text was translated after the Later Han.

column29: Zhenyuan Lu
column40: Alternative title from FGDB (s.v. 分別功德論). Based on internal evidence, Palumbo (2013, 168) states that the dating of the text to the Han dynasty originated with the Li Dai San Bao Ji. Palumbo (2013, 257) further states that it appears to be "the work of the original translation team, which produced the first redactions of the Zengyi ahan jing in A.D. 384–385: Dharmananda, Zhu Fonian, Dao’an, Zhao Zheng." Fang and Gao (2003) state that the attribution of the date to the Han dynasty in the Taisho is unlikely based of a lingustic analysis of the text. For example, the texts use of the character 被 bei is not elsewhere attested in Han dynasty literature.

column29: Notes on the Illustrations to the Old and Modern Translation
column40: Nattier (2023, 99) states that this translation is unlikely to be the work of An Shigao because he did not translate to verse in his authentically translated works. Fang and Lu (2023, 8) state that the term 死亡 used in the text is not a term used by An Shigao Li (2012) state that this term was not used until the the Three Kingdoms period. Radich (2019) includes this text in a list that the Li Dai San Bao Ji wrongly attributes a number of translations treated anonymously by Sengyou.

column40: This entry could potentially match three texts in the Taishō: 月燈三昧經 T 639 in 10 fascicles attributed to Narendrayaśas, 佛說月燈三昧經 T 640 in one fascicle attributed to Xian Gong, and 佛說月燈三昧經 T 641 also attributed to Xian Gong. T 639 can be ruled out due to the mismatch in length. T 640 and T 641 are equally likely to be a match.

Part 1: New List of Additional Anonymously Translated and Miscellaneous Sūtras
column18: Altogether, there are eleven sections brought by Master Ān and translated by Dharmarakṣa, including three hundred parables across twenty-five scrolls. These are mixed and without titles, making them difficult to distinguish. The newly compiled collection organizes and arranges them into scrolls to aid in reading. Upon examination, many of these texts likely originate from larger scriptures and were transmitted without translated titles. However, it is possible that some of them were indeed produced by Master Dharmarakṣa.

column4: Part 1: New List of Additional Anonymously Translated and Miscellaneous Sūtras
column18: Originally titled the Pu Guang Pusa Jing, or also called the Guan Ding Sui Yuan Wangsheng Shi Fang Jingtu Jing). There are a total of eleven sūtras, from the Qi Wan Er Qian Shen Wang Zhou to the Zhao Wu Fang Long Wang Zhou. These nine sutras are part of the earlier compilation collectively titled the Great Consecration Sūtra. The remaining three fascicles—Fan Tien Shen Ce, the Pu guang Jing, and the Ba Chu Guo Zui Jing—were compiled by later generations, completing the Great Consecration into twelve fascicles in total. However, since the Ba Chu Guo Zui Jing was excerpted into the “Records of Doubtful Scriptures,” it is not listed twice.
